rule.Name: AvoidConstructorsInStaticTypesRule
rule.problem: This type (and ancestors) contains only static fields and methods but has a visible, non static, constructor.
rule.solution: You should remove the visible constructor to make sure this type cannot be instantiated, or if using 2.0+, change it to a static type.

rule.Name: AvoidLongMethodsRule
rule.problem: Long methods are usually hard to understand and maintain. This method can cause problems because it contains more code than the maximum allowed.
rule.solution: You should apply an Extract Method refactoring, but there are other solutions.

rule.Name: AvoidRedundancyInMethodNameRule
rule.problem: This method's name includes the type name of the first parameter. This usually makes an API more verbose and less future-proof than necessary.
rule.solution: Remove the type from the method name, move the method into the parameter's type, or create an extension method (if using C#).

rule.Name: AvoidSmallNamespaceRule
rule.problem: This namespaces contains very few visible types.
rule.solution: Consider merging this namespace with its parent or a sibling.

target.defect: Only 3 visible types are defined inside this namespace.

rule.Name: AvoidSwitchStatementsRule
rule.problem: The problem with switch statements is the duplication. You may find the same switch in several places.

rule.Name: AvoidThrowingBasicExceptionsRule
rule.problem: This method creates (and probably throws) an exception of Exception, ApplicationException or SystemException type.
rule.solution: Try to use a more specific exception type. If none of existing types meet your needs, create a custom exception class that inherits from System.Exception or any appropriate descendant of it.

rule.Name: AvoidUnnecessarySpecializationRule
rule.problem: This method has a parameter whose type is more specialized than necessary. This can make it difficult to reuse the method in other contexts.
rule.solution: Replace the parameter type with the most general type which will work or make use of the specifics of the formal parameter type.

rule.Name: AvoidUnneededCallsOnStringRule
rule.problem: This method needlessly calls some method(s) on a string instance. This may produce some performance penalities.
rule.solution: Remove the unneeded call(s) on the string instance.

target.Name: System.Void Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program::EmailResults(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
target.defect: There is no need to call ToString() on a System.String instance.
There is no need to call ToString() on a System.String instance.

rule.Name: AvoidUnneededFieldInitializationRule
rule.problem: This constructor needlessly initializes zero initializes some fields.
rule.solution: Remove the unneeded initialization from the constructors.

rule.Name: AvoidVisibleNestedTypesRule
rule.problem: This type is both nested and visible outside the assembly. Nested types are often confused with namespaces.
rule.solution: Change the nested type to be invisible outside the assembly or un-nest it.

rule.Name: ConsiderUsingStaticTypeRule
rule.problem: This type contains only static fields and methods and should be static.
rule.solution: Change this type into a static type to gain clarity and better error reporting.

rule.Name: DoNotSwallowErrorsCatchingNonSpecificExceptionsRule
rule.problem: This method catches a very general exception without rethrowing it. This is not safe to do in general and may mask problems that the caller should be made aware of.
rule.solution: Rethrow the original exception (which will preserve the stacktrace of the original error) or catch a more specific exception type.

rule.Name: EnsureLocalDisposalRule
rule.problem: This disposable local is not guaranteed to be disposed of before the method returns.
rule.solution: Use a 'using' statement or surround the local's usage with a try/finally block.

target.Name: System.Void Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program::Main(System.String[])
target.defect: Local 'parser' of type 'FastAParser' is not disposed of (at least not locally).

target.Name: System.Void Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program::EmailResults(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
target.defect: Local 'client' of type 'SmtpClient' is not disposed of (at least not locally).

target.Name: System.Void Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.MPIComputeLowerTriangularBlocked::WriteFullMatrixOnRank0(System.String)
target.defect: Local 'fileStream' of type 'FileStream' is not disposed of (at least not locally).
Local 'writer' of type 'BinaryWriter' is not disposed of (at least not locally).

rule.Name: MarkAssemblyWithCLSCompliantRule
rule.problem: This assembly is not decorated with the [CLSCompliant] attribute.
rule.solution: Add this attribute to ease the use (or non-use) of your assembly by CLS consumers.

rule.Name: ReviewLinqMethodRule
rule.problem: A linq extension method with linear time complexity is used, but a more efficient method is available.

target.Name: Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program/AnalysisResults Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program::analyseAlignment(Bio.Algorithms.Alignment.PairwiseAlignedSequence)
target.defect: Use the Count property instead of the Count () method.

target.Name: Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program/GapInfo Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program/AnalysisResults::get_SeqALastGapInfo()
target.defect: Use operator [] instead of the Last method.

target.Name: Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program/GapInfo Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program/AnalysisResults::get_SeqBLastGapInfo()
target.defect: Use operator [] instead of the Last method.

rule.Name: UseCorrectCasingRule
rule.problem: This identifier (namespace, type, or method) violates the .NET naming conventions.
rule.solution: Change the namespace, type, or method name to be pascal-cased (like MyClass) and parameter names to be camel-cased (like myParameter).

target.Name: Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program/AnalysisResults Salsa.NeedlemanWunschTPL.Program::analyseAlignment(Bio.Algorithms.Alignment.PairwiseAlignedSequence)
target.defect: By existing naming conventions, all the method and property names should all be pascal-cased (e.g. MyOperation). Rename 'analyseAlignment' to 'AnalyseAlignment'.

rule.Name: UsePreferredTermsRule
rule.solution: For consistency replace any non-recommended term with the preferred one.

rule.Name: UseStringEmptyRule
rule.problem: The method uses literal "" instead of String.Empty.
rule.solution: Replace the empty string literal with String.Empty.
